DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of a new biopsy track ablation device for liver biopsy.
DOC.brief_title: A New Track Ablation Device for Liver Biopsy: A Feasibility Study
DOC.detailed_description: Background: - Percutaneous biopsy for hepatic masses has a potential risk of bleeding and peritoneal tumor seeding. - A new device for biopsy track ablation has been invented to reduce the risk of bleeding and peritoneal tumor seeding. Method: - Routine percutaneous biopsy for hepatic masses is performed. - Immediate after obtaining tissue, biopsy needle track is ablated with a new biopsy tract ablator. - Immediate (with ultrasound) and 24 hours (with CT scan) after procedure, occurrence of complications is evaluated.
DOC.criteria: patients with a hepatic mass on CT scan or MRI patients who are referred for percutaneous biopsy of a hepatic mass patients with normal range of platelet count and coagulation test pregnant women patients with ascites Uncooperative patients
